# Contributing to Lentera Aksara

First off, thank you for considering contributing to Lentera Aksara! It's people like you that make this project better.

## Code of Conduct

This project and everyone participating in it is governed by our Code of Conduct. By participating, you are expected to uphold this code.

## How Can I Contribute?

### Reporting Bugs

Before creating bug reports, please check the existing issues as you might find out that you don't need to create one. When you are creating a bug report, please include as many details as possible:

* Use a clear and descriptive title
* Describe the exact steps which reproduce the problem
* Provide specific examples to demonstrate the steps
* Describe the behavior you observed after following the steps
* Explain which behavior you expected to see instead and why
* Include screenshots if possible

### Suggesting Enhancements

Enhancement suggestions are tracked as GitHub issues. When creating an enhancement suggestion, please include:

* Use a clear and descriptive title
* Provide a step-by-step description of the suggested enhancement
* Provide specific examples to demonstrate the steps
* Describe the current behavior and explain which behavior you expected to see instead
* Explain why this enhancement would be useful

### Pull Requests

* Fill in the required template
* Follow the Laravel coding standards (PSR-12)
* Include thoughtfully-worded, well-structured tests
* Document new code
* End all files with a newline

## Development Setup

1. Fork the repository
2. Clone your fork: `git clone https://github.com/your-username/lentera-aksara.git`
3. Create a new branch: `git checkout -b feature/my-new-feature`
4. Make your changes
5. Run tests: `php artisan test`
6. Commit your changes: `git commit -am 'Add some feature'`
7. Push to the branch: `git push origin feature/my-new-feature`
8. Submit a pull request

## Documentation

Please update the relevant documentation when making changes:
- Main features: Update [README.md](../README.md)
- Feature guides: Add to [docs/guides/](../docs/guides/)
- Version changes: Update [CHANGELOG.md](../docs/CHANGELOG.md)
- Security issues: See [SECURITY.md](../docs/SECURITY.md)

## Coding Standards

### PHP
* Follow PSR-12 coding standards
* Use type hints where possible
* Write meaningful comments for complex logic
* Keep methods small and focused

### Blade Templates
* Use semantic HTML
* Keep logic out of views (use controllers/view composers)
* Use components for reusable elements
* Follow naming conventions

### JavaScript
* Use ES6+ features
* Keep functions small and focused
* Use meaningful variable names
* Add comments for complex logic

### CSS/Tailwind
* Follow mobile-first approach
* Use Tailwind utility classes
* Keep custom CSS minimal
* Follow dark mode color conventions

## Testing

* Write tests for new features
* Ensure all tests pass before submitting PR
* Maintain or improve code coverage

## Documentation

* Update README.md if needed
* Add JSDoc/PHPDoc comments
* Update feature documentation files

## Questions?

Feel free to open an issue with your question or contact the maintainer.
